headline: Bitcoin Fakeout? Research Firm Says Momentum Just Flipped Bearish
summary: Bitcoinâ€™s latest push towards $120,000 fizzled into a stall-out that now resembles a â€œfailed breakout zone,â€ according to market analytics firm Swissblock. In a July 31 thread, the firm said â€œmomentum has failed to ignite,â€ arguing that realized-profit flows and an overwhelming share of coins sitting in profit have turned every bounce into an opportunity for supply to meet price. Profit-Taking Cools Bitcoin Rally Swissblock framed the setback as a pause rather than a breakdown. â€œProfit-taking is risingâ€”but not as intense as late 2024,â€ the firm wrote, adding that the effect through July was â€œenough to cap upside and trigger consolidation.â€ The tone is cooling, not capitulatory: â€œSelling pressure is visible, but not extremeâ€”think cooling, not capitulation.â€ That diagnosis hinges on on-chain readings of realized profitâ€”an input that tends to expand into rallies as long-held coins are spent into strengthâ€”and a market structure in which bids are absorbing supply rather than being overwhelmed by it. Related Reading: Bitcoin New Investor Dominance Rises â€“ No Signs of Mass Profit-Taking Yet The most striking datapoint in the thread is breadth of profitability: â€œ96% of supply is in profit,â€ Swissblock noted, citing Glassnode. That ratio is historically consistent with late-cycle euphoria, but it is also mechanically self-limiting; when nearly all holders are in the green, latent sell pressure rises because â€œunrealized gains are tempting sellers.â€ As Swissblock put it, â€œStrong holders remain. But unrealized gains are tempting sellers. Until demand returns, each bounce invites supply.â€ The firm contends the broader trend â€œis intactâ€”but momentum needs a reset.â€ Beyond on-chain realized flows, the firmâ€™s composite fundamentals read neutral with improving liquidity. â€œBTC fundamentals are strong and stable,â€ Swissblock wrote, pointing to a Bitcoin Fundamentals Index reading of 60 (neutral), â€œNetwork Growth is cooling,â€ and â€œLiquidity is recovering.â€ That mix typically favors range behavior over directional surgesâ€”â€œa consolidation-supportive environment,â€ as the post put itâ€”in which Bitcoin â€œcan grind sideways longerâ€”until itâ€™s ready to break with conviction.â€ The implication is that the marketâ€™s â€œfailed breakoutâ€ risk reflects timing rather than trend reversal: positioning and liquidity are not aligned yet for a sustained continuation. Related Reading: Weak Bitcoin Treasury Companies Will Be Crushed By Bear Market, Insider Warns The cross-asset context is equally nuanced. â€œAltseason is activeâ€”but under stress,â€ Swissblock wrote, observing that while â€œ$ETH continues to outperform BTC structurally, holding up better in this pullback,â€ most altcoins are sagging, with â€œonly 5% of top 100 showing positive impulse.â€ That thinning rotation underlines the selectivity of risk appetite and the fragility of momentum outside of the largest names. Historically, that pattern often precedes a decisive move in Bitcoin that either recharges the rotation or breaks it. Swissblockâ€™s concluding assessment leans cautiously constructive. â€œProfit-taking is fading and selling pressure is being absorbed. BTC is preparing for breakoutâ€”but momentum needs to align.â€ Until that alignment arrives, the firm expects a grind: bids continue to meet supply from profitable holders, realized profits moderate, and liquidity improves in the background. If and when Bitcoin flips momentum back to positive, Swissblock argues, the spillover could be forceful: â€œWhile BTC grinds sideways, watch for the moment it flipsâ€”ETH and altcoins will likely explode upward when it does.â€ In short, todayâ€™s dip to $115,000 looks less like an outright rejection than a test of the marketâ€™s ability to digest profits and reset momentum without damage to the underlying uptrend. With 96% of supply in profit and breadth compressed, the next impulse likely hinges on whether liquidity and demand can reassert themselves before profit-taking reaccelerates. For now, Swissblockâ€™s message is clear: the breakout will need to be earned, not assumed. At press time, BTC traded at $115,452. Featured image created with DALL.E, chart from TradingView.com
